title: French PM Barnier puts austerity on the menu in 2025 budget
summary: The new government presented its draft budget, which includes tax increases to bring the deficit down to 5% of GDP next year. The financial cost of the Macron years has forced the new government to undertake a major effort to put public finances back on track.

title: Israel strikes central Beirut, killing 22
summary: Israel has been pounding Hezbollah in Lebanon since September 23 in an escalated campaign that has killed more than 1,200 people and displaced more than a million others, according to an AFP tally of health ministry figures.

title: The battle between Netanyahu and his defense minister
summary: Disagreements between Benjamin Netanyahu and Yoav Gallant over the war in Gaza and Lebanon emerged in the immediate aftermath of the October 7, 2023 attack by Hamas.

title: Azerbaijan: Repression intensifies in the run-up to COP29 in Baku
summary: Arrests against dissenting voices and civil society are on the increase, according to a report by the NGOs Human Rights Watch and Freedom Now. At least 30 people have been detained, ahead of the UN COP29 climate summit starting on November 11.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sex trafficking trial set for May 2025
summary: Allegations have been building against the Grammy winner since last year, when singer Cassie alleged Combs subjected her to more than a decade of coercion by physical force and drugs as well as a 2018 rape.

title: Richard Gasquet, backhand specialist who, win or lose, always awes, plans to retire
summary: The 38-year-old tennis player announced on Thursday that he would be calling time on his career at next year's French Open. It will be an opportunity to say goodbye to a public which, despite his limitations, has always been particularly fond of him.

title: France's great consumption slump
summary: Despite a clear downturn in inflation, household spending is struggling to recover. High prices, low wage growth, and increased housing costs are weighing on consumers.

title: Hurricane Kirk: Record rainfall for autumn, exacerbated by climate change
summary: The passage of Hurricane Kirk increased the rainfall surplus of an already very wet year in France. These phenomena have been amplified by the effects of climate change, particularly the warming of ocean waters.

title: The British government proposes 'the biggest upgrade to workers' rights in a generation'
summary: The highly ambitious Employment Rights Bill aims to restore rights and stability to employees after 25 years of casualization of work in the UK.

title: France, Britain grant Palestinian Authority nearly $20 million in aid
summary: In recent months, several senior Palestinian officials including the minister of the economy have warned about the risk of the West Bank economy collapsing.

title: France beats Israel 4-1 in Nations League
summary: The 2021 Nations League champions are in Brussels to face Belgium on Monday, with Israel up against Italy in Udine.

title: Hurricane Milton leaves 'at least 10' dead in Florida
summary: The storm, which made landfall as a Category 3 storm on Wednesday night, led to tornadoes and flooding throughout Florida, killing at least 10 and leaving more than 3 million people without power.

title: Protests banned in French island Martinique and curfew declared after riots
summary: Authorities said 26 law enforcement officers were injured in new riots in the French overseas territory in the Caribbean. Protests began last month over the cost of living.

title: Musk's all-out crusade, from buying Twitter to actively supporting Trump
summary: In the space of a few months, the multi-billionaire seems to have partly tied his fate, and the future of his companies such as Tesla, to the outcome of the US presidential election.

title: Ethel Kennedy, social activist and wife of Robert F. Kennedy, dies at 96
summary: Ethel Kennedy, an activist on causes such as gun control and human rights who received a Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2014, died on Thursday. The wife of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, she had raised their 11 children.

title: Zelensky meets Macron to discuss 'victory plan'
summary: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky, in Paris after talks with Keir Starmer and NATO head Mark Rutte in London, thanked Emmanuel Macron for his support after they spoke about strategy for the 'next weeks and months.'

title: Rafael Nadal, the clay-court gladiator, announces his retirement
summary: The Spaniard announced Thursday he was ending his career. His name will remain closely associated with the French Open, where the left-hander won 14 times, symbolizing his almost absolute rule on clay.

title: Morocco built Africa's largest theater but it remains closed
summary: Rabat's giant infrastructure, which cost almost €200 million, is still closed three years after completion, leaving local elected officials baffled.

title: France's budget under close European scrutiny
summary: In addition to presenting its budget bill on Thursday, October 10, Paris, which is subject to the excessive deficit procedure, is preparing to send its roadmap to Brussels for compliance with the Maastricht Treaty.

title: Obama hits campaign trail in critical Pennsylvania to rev up support for Harris
summary: The former president painted Trump as out-of-touch and not the choice to lead the country to change, calling him a 'bumbling' billionaire 'who has not stopped whining about his problems since he rode down his golden escalator nine years ago.'
